attributes.action: Apologise for the slave compensation scheme and donate to Black Lives Matter.
attributes.additional_details: In times like these it is important that the people are able to trust their government. I believe that a public apology and a sizeable donation (perhaps directly to Black Lives Matter) would show solidarity for the Black Lives Matter movement, and help to put this country onto the right side of history.
attributes.background: In 1833 the British government paid out £20m to slave owners for the loss of their "property" when slave-ownership was abolished in British colonies. Since then tax payers have been paying this amount back.  Make a public apology and make a sizeable donation to underprivileged black communities.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Reimburse tax payers for monies used to compensate slave owners: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325300 

Refund taxes used to pay slavery abolition debt to British descendants of slaves: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325536 

Pay Slavery Reparations to all Caribbean & African Descendants: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325237 

Legislate for the provision of reparations to communities affected by slavery: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325529
